directions: Preheat a Breville panini press and grill on the sear setting. Put the meat in a bowl and mix in the burger seasoning. Divide the meat into 4 equal portions and shape each into a patty.

Place the burgers on the panini press and lower the top plate. Cook until medium-rare, 4 to 6 minutes, or to your desired doneness, raising the top plate and placing a slice of cheese on top of each burger during the last minute of cooking. Transfer to a platter.

Brush the cut sides of the buns with butter. Place the buns, cut side down, on the panini press and cook until lightly toasted, about 1 minute. Place the burgers on the bottom buns and top with lettuce, pickles and tomatoes. Drizzle with sauce, cover with the top half of the buns and serve immediately. Serves 4.
ingredients: 1 1/2 lb. (750 g) ground beef, preferably ground chuck
4 slices cheddar cheese, each about 1 oz. (30 g)
Lettuce leaves, dill pickle slices and tomato slices for serving
title: The Ultimate Cheeseburger
